page.title: 17EDINGWORTH
page.content: IN THE SOUTH WEST CORNER OF THE BLOCK IS THE VILLAGE OF EDINGWORTH,BISECTED BY THE M5 MOTORWAY,IT IS NOW DOMINATED BY THE SOUND AND VISION OF TRAFFIC ON ITS WAY TO,OR FROM,THE WEST OF ENGLAND. THE THREE FARM HOUSES,TOGETHER WITH THEIR NEARBY COTTAGES,CONSTITUTE THIS HAMLET.THERE ARE NO SHOPS,THE ONLY AMENITIES ARE A TELEPHONE KIOSK AND A LETTER BOX. AGRICULTURE IS THE MAINSTAY OF LIFE HERE,DAIRY FARMING DOMINATES.A FEW SHEEP CAN BE SEEN AND A FEW HORSES.THE HORSES ARE USED FOR LEISURE RATHER THAN FOR WORK. THE LAND IS FLAT WITH A MIXED FLORA AND FAUNA.
